name: Bite-Sized Salmon Tikka
author: Tarama
summary: Salmon is versatile, highly nutritious, and can be bought fresh or frozen. This 'Indianised' recipe is quick, tasty, and ideal as a short snack or a meal eaten with a salad. Serve with Masala Chai. You can try this recipe with any white fish: cod, haddock, pollock, etc.
ingredients: ½ pound wild Pacific salmon fillets, cut into 1-inch cubes
directions: Mix together the cayenne, turmeric, and salt in a bowl
Add the salmon to the bowl and toss to coat
Heat the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
While the oil is heating, sprinkle the cornstarch over the salmon and again toss to coat
Cook the salmon in the heated oil until golden brown, about 1 minute per side
